page.title: 04Bird watching,Ravensthorpe
page.content: Ravensthorpe reservoir has one of the best areas in Northamptonshire for bird watching,being in the top 3 with 150 regular species.The sanctuary is unusual in that it is owned and run by the Anglia Water Authority.Some of the native ducks are the tufted shoveler, teal,golden eye and great crested grebe One duck that overwinters,the long tail,is usually a sea bird.There are several ferral colonies the largest of which are the Canada Geese.They eat a lot of corn from neighbouring fields. Occasional migrating birds such as the arctic tern get blown off course and stay but our most prestigious visitor is the osprey.However the real value of the area is in it being a constant home to so many ordinary birds.Entry is pro- hibited but many keen birdwatchers enjoy studying with binoculars such a variety of birds in a peaceful setting.
